body_text.text: Biology Meharry Medical College Faculty positions will be available in 1992/93 in the Department of Biochemistry, at the level of Assistant or Associate Professor. Applicants must have a Ph.D. or M.D. degree, or both, and appropriate formal postdoctoral research experience. Joint appointments in clinical science departments are possible. We are seeking individuals who have potential or demonstrated competence in the use of molecular biological approaches to conduct research in molecular medicine, or on fundamental biochemical/cell biological problems. Selected individuals must also be capable of, and committed to, making significant contributions to the teaching and administrative functions of the department of biochemistry. Successful applicants will be expected to develop/maintain a funded research program of high quality and to participate in the graduate and professional (medical, dental and allied health) school teaching programs of the Department. Applicants should send curriculum vitae, names of four individuals who may be contacted for reference, and a summary (not exceeding 3 pages) of potential research project(s) to: Ifeanyl J. Arinze, Ph.D., Chalrman, Dept of Biochamistry, Meharry Medical College, Nashville, TN 37266. An EO/M Empber.

Graduate Training in Viral Oncoiogy and immunology New York University Medical School Stipends are available for students pursuing a Ph.D. in molecular oncology or immunology beginning September 1993. The principal interests of participating faculty are viral and cellular oncogenes, growth control, and molecular, cellular, and tumor immunology.

Students will be supported chiefly by an NIH programmatic training grant, requiring US citizenship, OI resident status. We strongly encourage applications from minority students. Limited funding is also available outside of this source. Information and applications forms are available from:

Two postdoctoral positions are available to study intermediate filaments and their associated proteins. Projects invoive: 1. Studying the function of keratins in simple epithelial cells such as the intestine and liver, using molecular and biochemical approaches. 2. Study ing the Interaction of intermediate filaments with protein kinase C and other associated proteins. 3. Studying the mechanism of intermediate filament alterations in disease states. Reference of our most recent work can be seen in J. Ceil Bfof. 117:563 (1992) , and J. Blot. C~WII. 35?:3901 (1992) . Candidates should have experience in any of the following broad areas: molecular biology, protein biochemistry, or carbohydrate biochemistry.

body_text.text: The Department of Biology, University of California, San Diego invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the assistant professor level In the general area of Mammalian Molecular Biology. The position is available effective Fall, 1993, subject to availability of funding. Possible areas of interest Include molecular controls of mammalian development, targeted mutations in the mouse genome, signal transduction, hematopoieeis, DNA replication, regulatory mechanisms involved in post-transcriptional processing, transport, or translation of mRNA, and the function of higher order chromosomal structures. Exceptional candidates in all areas of mammalian molecular biology will be considered. Salary will be commensurate with level of appointment and based on UC published salary scale. The successful candidate is expected to develop a vigorous research program and to participate in the department's undergraduate and graduate teaching program. A Ph.D. and productive postdoctoral training are required.
body_text.section: The University of California at San Diego Department of Biology Faculty Position in Mammalian Molecular Biology

body_text.text: Please submit curriculum vitae, a statement of professional goals and research interests, and the names of 3 references by February 15, 1993
body_text.section: The University of California at San Diego Department of Biology Faculty Position in Mammalian Molecular Biology

body_text.text: The Unhwsfty of California, San Francisco seeks applications for a tenure track position of Assistant or Associate Professor in the Department of Physiology. We seek someone holding a Ph.D. and/or M.D. who will develop an active, independent research program that uses molecular, cellular or integrative methods to investigate problems in mammalian biology. The candidate will be expected to take an active role in a ne\ Biomedii Sciences Graduate Program and to participate in teaching mammalian physiology to medical students. Applicants should include a curriculum vitae, statements of teaching experience and research interests, reprints of up to three selected publications, and the names of three individuals who have been askel to submit reference letters. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply. Applications should be sent to: Seeks qualified molecular biologists for its expanding biomedical research program. The newly established Department of Experimental Oncology has immediate openings for several faculty positions, M.D.'s and Ph.D.'s whose research focuses on the genes and proteins involved in cancer induction and progression are encouraged to apply. Although preference will be given to physician-scientists who have recently completed postdoctoral training and have strong interests in molecular medicine, applicants with extensive experience in cancer research will be considered for positions at the associate and full-member levels.

Successful applicants will work in a 24QooO square foot research center, completed in 1991, which houses all of the institute's scientific programs. Opportunities exist for interaction with specialists in Virology/Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Immunology, Tumor Cell Biology, Pharmacology, Hematology/Oncology, and Infectious Diseases. St. Jude provides generous start-up funds, nationally competitive salaries and an excellent benefits package. A strong institutional commitment to the basic science faculty ensures stability in program development and continuity of research activities.
Applicants should submit a curriculum vitae, a letter summarizing their research accomplishments and goals, and the names of three references to:

Dr to study the molecular genetics, endocrinology and cell biology of a unique, newly discovered family of overlapping human genes encoding extracellular matrix proteins and steroidogenic enzymes. The successful applicant will join an established laboratory of 10-12 postdocs and graduate students studying the molecular biology of steroid hormone synthesis. Skills with cloning, sequencing, PCR gene walking, RNase protections, gene transfer, site directed mutagenesis, cell free translation and cell biology preferred. Salary according to training and experience. The research data will be published in peer reviewed scientific journals. Posiion supervises and instructs students and laboratory technicians in research techniques. The research includes but is not limited to synthesis of adenosine receptor peptide, raising of polyclonal antibodies, development of immunoaffinity chromatography, development of radioimmunoassays, high performance liquid chromatography and cell culture of vascular smooth muscle cells.

Requires doctorate in biochemistry, pharmacology or related field and two years of biomedical research. Experience must include studying of cardiovascular sciences, especially the study of second messenger systems is a must. Doing education or experience, training should include protein purification, enzyme assays, antibody production and utilization, radioimmunoassays, vascular cell culture, and use of specialized instruments, i.e., high pressure liquid chromatography (HPLC), polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Resumes must include social security Number Applications are invited for the post of Senior Transgenics Offker sited in the above Centre. The CGR maintains an extensive programme of research applying trsnsgenic technology to problems of interest in fundamental biology.

agriculture and medicine. The successful applicant will be in charge of a group engaged in the production of transgenic mice. Procedures include DNA manipulation. pronuclear micro injection, detection of transgenics by PCR and management of recipient and transgenic mice.
The appointee will also be requtred to liaise closely with other research groups.

The Initial appointment will be either on scale El2. In addition to the above stated eligibility requirements, applicants must be U.S. citizens and must have completed their formal clinical training by the projected time of entry into the program.

Applications for appointment in 1994 must be submitted by April 30, 1993. Interviews with selected applicants will be carried out in July 1993, and successful candidates will be notified in November 1993.
SubstantM resources are available to create and sustain a major program in fundamental de4opmental biilogy, which will occupy an entire floor of a brand new research building.

The Department of Therapeutic Radiology at the Yale University School of Medicine is seeking highly qualified candidates for a position in its RADIOBIOLOGY SECTION. Candidates should have research interests that complement existing research in the Section on DNA repair, recombination, mutagenesis, and the roles of oncogenes and tumor suppressor genes in human cancer. A strong record of research accomplishment and support is expected. The appointment will be at the level appropriate for the successful candidate, from Assistant Professor to Professor. Dept of Medical Genetics University of Torontc Applications are invited for a contractually limited term appointment (3 yrs) in the areas of developmental genetics. human genetics, microbial genetics, or protein structure and function. Requirements include a Ph.D. degree or equivalent, and established excellence in research in one of these areas. The position will be located in the Medical Sciences Building on the downtown campus of the University of Toronto. The Department has established excellence in research in all of the above areas.
body_text.section: Yale School of Medicine Faculty Position

body_text.text: The successful applicant will be expected to compete effectively for external funding and to contribute to the teaching programmes of the Department, The appointment will be at the Assistant Professor level and will begin July, 1993. The Department of Orthopedic Surgery at the BriQham and Women's Hospital seeks wellqualified applicants with a background in biochemistry or tnofecufar Mofo~y for a research position in the Orthopedic Research Laboratory. Associated with this position is an academic appointment in Orthopedic Surgery (Biochemistry or Molecular Biology) at Harvard Medical School. Candidates should have completed 3 to 5 years of relevant postdoctoral experience. The applicant should have the capability of directing an independent program in musculoskeletal research and an interest in collaborating in multidisciplinary projects with other Laboratory investigators. There will be opportunities to participate in teaching and to act as research advisor to medical students, graduate students, residents, and postdoctoral fellows.

FIGREF1.text: Medical Faculty Development Program, sponsored by the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, has up to twelve new positions available beginning in 1994. The program offers postdoctoral research fellowships to physicians from under-represented minority groups as defined by the Association of American Medical Colleges. These individuals must have demonstrated superior academic and clinical skills and have committed themselves to careers in academic medicine with special interest in either BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH, CLINICAL INVESTIGATION OR HEALTH SERVICES RESEARCH. The fellowship supports four consecutive years of research. Each Fellow selected will receive an annual stipend of up to $SO,CIW.~ with 5% increases per year and a fixed $25,ooO.oO annual grant toward support of research activities.

Applicants should have a Ph.D. or M.D. degree with three years postdoctoral experience in the areas of molecular biology of breast cancer, leukemogenesis, signal transduction, oncogenes/suppressor genes or drug resistance. Successful candidates will be part of the newly constructed Molecular Oncology Laboratories, Lady Davis Institute and will be funded initially by the NCI Terry Fox Development Program. Two postdoctoral training positions are available in the Department of Tumor Cell Biology. Studies will be conducted in one of the following areas: Dr. James Downing: Investigation of the function of the PCTAIRE family of cdcBrelated serine/threonine kinases in cell cycle regulation (see Oncogene, 7:2249225&1992). Dr. Scott Hlebart: Investigation of the cell cycle regulation of the E2F transcriptional factor by the retinoblastoma protein or studies aimed at characterizing the role of the AML-1 transcriptional factor in acute myeloid leukemia.Both positions are immediately available. Experience with recombinant DNA, mammalian expression systems, and/or protein purification and biochemistry is essential. These positions require scientists capable of working aggressively in highly competitive research areas. Interested candidates should send their curriculum vitae and the names of three references to the relevant investigator at: Department of Tumor Cell Biology, St Jude Children's Research Hospital, 332 North Lauderdale, Memphis, TN 38105. back_matter.text: University of Wisconsin-Madison An assistant professor position will be available on January 1, 1994 for a person with strong biochemical research and teaching interests. The abilities of the applicant are more important than the particular area of research interest. Department faculty have active basic and applied research programs in biological chemistry, molecular biology and molecular genetics, with an emphasis on the structure and function of proteins and nucleic acids, cellular control mechanisms and hormone action. Department faculty also have teaching responsibilities for graduate, medical and health science students. Applicants should have at least two years of biochemical postdoctoral research experience. They should submit a curriculum vitae, bibliography, letters of reference from three persons knowledgeable of the candidate's research or teaching abilities, and a one or two page statement of future research interests to: By May l,lW3. The Uniwsity of Wisconsin is an Equal Q+Muni&/~~atiw Action Employer. Applications from qualified women, minorities, and/or disabled individuals an? encouraged. In accordance with recent state legislation, unless confidentiality is tsquested in writing, intixmation regarding applicants and nominees must be &eased upon request. Finalists cannot be guaranteed com7dentiaMy.
